intro: Boronia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is often found in sandstone-derived soils. Its flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its ecological role in pollination. Boronia lanceolata is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
